info.name: 3_VirtualMedia
info.description:
This collection proposes mount and unmount Virtual drive requests using the Redfish standard and the legacy HPE Oem implementation. 

The first versions of the Redfish [VirtualMedia](http://redfish.dmtf.org/schemas/v1/VirtualMedia.json) were very limited in terms of actions and properties. However, in order to propose a decent user experience, HPE implemented its own Virtual Media subsystem under the Oem sub-tree, as permitted by the Redfish standard.

Today, and for backward compatibility, HPE implements both the Redfish VirtualMedia standard and its legacy Oem implementation.

[Published](https://documenter.getpostman.com/view/3625509/RzfmESXS)

request.description:
Mount a remote .ISO file via HTTP using a standard POST request toward an Action target.

NOTE: if you want the server to boot on this Virtual Media during the next reboot, you have to send a separate PATCH request. See the BootOnNextServerReset request in this collection.

Retrieves the CD/DvD Virtual Media properties.

Note the standard "Actions" and the legacy "Oem.Hpe.Actions" properties. 

Note as well that the BootOnNextReset boolean is under the Oem.Hpe sub-tree.

Sets BootOnNextServerReset to true in the Oem.Hpe subtree. This is the companion request of the StandardDvdMount request.


This request successful only when the managed server is Off or in FinishedPost state.

If the server is in InPost or in InPostDiscoveryComplete state this request will return an error.

See the [Master the Redfish Server States](https://developer.hpe.com/blog/master-the-redfish-server-states-to-improve-your-monitoring-and-manageme) article for more information on this subject.

POST request toward an Action target as defined by Redfish to unmount a CD or DvD Virtual Media.

Note that this requests automatically resets to false the BootOnNextServerReset boolean, if needed.

Legacy Dvd Mount + Boot On Next Server reset

With this PATCH request toward the Oem.Hpe subtree we can perform 2 actions at one time: mount a Virtual DvD and set the BootOnNextServerReset boolean to true.

Note that the second action will be successful only if the server is in the Off or FinishedPost state.

Read the [Master the Redfish Server States](https://developer.hpe.com/blog/master-the-redfish-server-states-to-improve-your-monitoring-and-manageme) article for more information on the server states.

Legacy POST request toward an Oem.Hpe Action target to mount a DvD virtual Media.

Note that it does not set the BootOnNextServerReset to true. If needed, use the BootOnNextServer PATCH request in this collection to perform this action.

Legacy DvD POST request toward an Oem.Hpe Action target.

Note that it will reset the BootOnNextServerReset boolean to false if needed.
